final_answer.precision_note: Three significant figures based on input values (0.200, 25.0, 250.0 all have 3 sig figs). Original volumes in cm3 converted to same units for ratio calculation.

method: Using the dilution formula c1V1 = c2V2 where c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3 and V1 = 25.0 cm3 are transferred and diluted to V2 = 250.0 cm3. Convert volumes maintain ratio (cm3 units cancel). Rearranging: c2 = (c1 × V1) / V2. Substitute values: (0.200 × 25.0) / 250.0. Calculate numerator: 5.00. Divide by denominator: 5.00 / 250.0 = 0.0200. Check: dilution factor is 10× (250/25), so concentration reduces by factor of 10, from 0.200 to 0.0200. Volume units must be consistent; cm3 ratio gives dimensionless factor. Final answer in mol dm-3 matches input concentration unit.
checks: Dilution factor of 10× (250.0/25.0) confirms 10× volume increase means 10× concentration decrease from 0.200 to 0.0200
Ratio calculation: 25.0 cm3 / 250.0 cm3 = 0.100, multiplied by 0.200 mol dm-3 = 0.0200 mol dm-3
Units preserved: input concentration in mol dm-3, output in mol dm-3
